intro: Hieracium macranthelops, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 40–100 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium macranthelops is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
